aboutMe.hobbies: My free time is spent on reading, handycraft and taking care of my sizeable plant collection: I am especially proud about my lemon tree. I also hold working out in high regard: I attend badminton and self-defense classes and my mornings always start with a yoga session.

passion.part1: My special focus is on User Experience (UX) and Accessibility (a11y). I am constantly educating myself on these topics and have also attended multiple conferences. One of the best learning experiences I have had was quite recently: I attended a workshop where a blind person demonstrated how he navigates the web, followed by tips for further improvement.
passion.part2: My dream website is one that anyone could use without requiring any extra instructions.

aboutMe.title: About me
aboutMe.work: I might be a front-end developer by profession but I do not shy away from back-end or design either. I am in search for a place in a collective where completing a sprint is a fundamental belief and code reviews are something to learn from. My wish is to work in a team where decisions are made together and overcoming difficulties is a joint effort as well. I know how to find solutions to my problems but can also tell when it is a good time to ask for help.

contacts.codeInfo: The code for this CV can be found on GitHub
contacts.description: If you feel like you are up for a collaboration then contact me
contacts.title: Contact me

reaalkool.name: Tallinn Secondary School of Science (Tallinna Reaalkool)

new.description: Feel free to contact me if you are interested in collaborations or hiring me!
new.title: My future job

codeyra.description: My own personal company, which I use for freelance work. My focus is on web development but can also help with design work. I have also been expanding my knowledge in the SEO field lately.

icefire.description: Icefire is a software agency, which means I got to work on various different projects. Among those were the Starman website with self-service and also multiple projects for the Estonian Tax and Customs Board. I also managed the component library that many of the latter were built on.

ismith.description: My current place of employment. I-Smith is a software agency that is turning into a service company. Being part of this process has given me the opportunity to see up-close how a product can be converted into a general-purpose service, from branding to customer acquisition.

krediidipank.description: This is where I did my internship for university. My job was to enter formulas into a program similar to Excel that the accountants would then use to generate reports.

telia.description: I was part of the TV team that was responsible for managing the TeliaTV user interface: the same one you might see in your TV if you have that service! Working there definitely gave me a strong base in vanilla JavaScript, since that is what our codebase was written in.
